comment._content: There's a small collection of papers related to Gertrude Farquharson Boyle Kanno (1878-1937) at the California Historical Society: www.oac.cdlib.org/search?style=oac4;Institution=Californi... comment.author: 75808391@N07
comment._content: The pictures are from 1913 depicting Kanno's "Creation Dawn" play at the Forest Theater in Carmel. This was the first public appearance of Henry Cowell who performed the music for the performance. Two years later, Gertrude went to New York with Eitaro Ishigaki. She divorced Kanno in 1919 but then remarried him in 1929 after Ishigaki left her for Ayako Ishigaki "Restless Wave". Takeshi and Gertrude met at Joaquin Miller's "hights" and lived there for 8 years. The photos may have been by Louis J. Stellman who spoke at Gertrude's memorial in 1937.
